Name: bie jia
Common: hard shell of soft shell turtle

Geography: Mainly produced in Hubei, Anhui, Jiangsu, Henan, Zhejiang, Jiangxi provinces of China
Maladies Treated: yinxu (yin deficient) with flashes: usually combine with qing hao (Artemisia annua), di gu pi (Lycium root bark)
yinxu with heat and pain: usually combine with gui ban (turtle shell), mu li (oyster shell), bai shao (white peony root), e jiao (donkey hide gelatin)

chronic malaria, pain in rib and chest, amenorrhea, cirrhosis (hardening and swelling) of liver and spleen: usually combine with san leng (Sparganium), e zhu (Curcuma zedoaria), qing pi (unripe tangerine peel), xiang fu zi (nutgrass rhizome), hong hua (Carthamus safflower), tao ren (peach kernel)
Medical Function: prevent cirrhosis of liver and spleen

anti-tumor effect: soft shell turtle shell powder, for oral use of 280 mg/kg in mice with transplanted cancer MH134, inhibited tumors with reduced diameter, and significantly reduced tumor weight; but for ascites carcinoma there was no significant effect

on nude mice with transplanted human colon cancer cells, given daily dose of 800mg/kg of soft shell turtle shell powder for 35 days, the inhibitory rate was 92.15%, and tumor necrosis area was 67%; compared to using the drug 5-fluorouracil (5-Fu), the advantage was that it did not cause white blood cell count to decrease; this indicates that the turtle shell powder can inhibit colorectal cancer in humans, with only small side effect and bone marrow suppression effect is much less than that of 5-Fu
suppresses yang by promoting yin (when used untreated/raw)
softens hardness and disperses clumps (when roasted in sand)
Dosage: For internal use: 10 to 24 g in decoction. For external use: make into powder. Use appropriate amount and apply to affected area.
Samples of Formulae:
For enlargement of liver and spleen: bie jia jian wan (Bie Jia Decoction Pill). 
 Bie jia should be cooked first (cook longer than other herbs) or roasted in sand.
 In promoting yin and and suppressing yang, bie jia should be use untreated. 
 For treating breast tumors, it should be roasted in sand first.
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of lack of appetite, loose stool due to pixu (spleen deficient). Use with care in cases of pregnancies.
Research:
Soft shell turtle shell powder for oral use of 280 mg/kg in mice with transplanted cancer MH134 inhibited tumors with reduced diameter and significantly reduced tumor weight; but for ascites carcinoma there was no significant effect.

In nude mice with transplanted human colon cancer cells, given daily dose of 800mg/kg of soft shell turtle shell powder for 35 days, the inhibitory rate was 92.15%, and tumor necrosis area was 67%. Compared to using the drug 5-fluorouracil (5-Fu), the advantage was that it did not cause white blood cell count to decrease. This indicates that the turtle shell powder can inhibit colorectal cancer in humans, with only small side effect and bone marrow suppression effect is much less than that of 5-Fu.

(Source: Zhong Hua Ben Cao)
Notes:
Those bie jia (soft turtle shells) sold, if they are clean and white in color, most of them have been extracted for bie jia jiao (gelatin). They are waste product and do not have medicinal value. Unprocessed bie jia should still contain some skin and flesh.

sheng bie jia is raw shell, mainly used in nourishing yin (in yinxu (yin deficient) condition).

zhi bie jia is baked shell, mainly used for swollen liver or spleen.

Chronic malaria or repeated occurrence of malaria can cause enlargement of liver and spleen, also known as nüe mu (malaria-mother) or nüe pi (malaria-splenomegaly).

Softening hardness and dispersing clumps refers to the TCM concepts of 'ji ju' (accumulation), 'jie' (knot), and 'jian' (firmness), which are terms found in classical Chinese medical texts to describe breast tumors. Commonly used TCM herbs for softening hardness and dispersing clumps include ao jia (turtle shell), xia ku cao (selfheal), kun bu (kelp), hai zao (seaweed), mu li (oyster shell), etc.

For treating breast tumors, it should be roasted in sand first.治陰 虛潮熱 ﹕  常配青 蒿 ,   地骨皮等同用 ；治陰虛陽亢動風 ﹕  常與龜 板  ,    牡蠣 ,    白 芍 ,   阿膠等同用 。治久瘧 ,   瘧母 ,   胸脅作痛及月經不通 ，癥瘕 積聚等症 ﹕ 可 與 三 棱 ,   莪朮  ,   青皮 ,    香附子 ,   紅花 ,  桃仁等 配 伍應用 。 治肝脾腫大、甲狀線及淋巴 腺腫大。 治再 生障礙性貧血（即骨髓不造血）。 生 品先煎或砂炙。滋陰潛陽宜生用，軟堅散結宜砂炙用。 Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕animal colloid, among them collagen is the main constituent, keratin, iodine, vitamin D, calcium phosphate, calcium carbonate.動物膠，其中骨膠原為主要成份，角蛋白，碘質，維生素D，磷酸鈣，碳酸鈣等。Dosage:用 量﹕For internal use: 10 to 24 g in decoctionFor external use: make into powder. Use appropriate amount and apply to affected area.內服 入煎劑 ，常用具10～24克。 外用：研末撒或調敷。Samples of formulae:處方舉 例﹕For enlargement of liver and spleen: bie jia jian wan 鱉甲煎丸Modern Research:現代研究﹕ Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕Not to use in cases of lack of appetite, loose stool due to pixu (spleen deficient)Use with care in cases of pregnancies脾虛,  食少便溏及 孕婦慎 服qualify of herb:飲片的質量：Those bie jia (soft turtle shells) sold, if they are clean and white in color, most of them have been extracted for bie jia jiao (gelatin). They are waste product and do have have medicinal value.市上賣的潔白， 看來很乾淨的鱉甲大多數經過熬煉鱉甲膠的廢物, 沒有藥用價值。沒經過熬煉的鱉甲應該還帶有一些皮肉的。sheng bie jia is raw shell, mainly used in nourishing yin (in yinxu (yin deficient)  condition).zhi bie jia is baked shell, mainly used for swollen liver or spleen.生 鱉 甲 ，即  鱉 甲生 用 。 主 要 用 於 滋 陰 潛 陽 。炙 鱉 甲 ，即 砂 炙之  鱉 甲   . 主 要 用 於 軟 堅 散 結 。瘧母即慢性瘧疾或瘧疾反復發作所致的肝脾腫大。亦稱瘧痞。軟堅散結：乳癌腫瘤在中醫古典著作中稱為「積聚」, 「結」, 「堅」等。軟堅散結常用的中藥有鰲甲, 夏枯草, 昆布, 海藻, 牡蠣等 等。Search this siteProblems with website? Name: dan shen
丹參
Other name: bie xue dan shen 鱉血丹參

Medical Function: anti HBV effect. The anti HBV effect is stronger when combined with zhu ling (Polyporus sclerotium) [1]
hepatoprotective: inhibits fibrinogen and aids in the resorption of fibrous plaques in the liver
Significantly increase in coronary blood flow due to reduction of vascular resistance

antifibrosis of liver; enhances preservation of donor liver; removes oxygen free radicals in liver cells; reduces damage from ischemia and reperfusion, reduces fatty degeneration and necrosis of liver cells; promotes regeneration of remnant liver; prevents recurrence and metastasis of liver cancer; affects portal hypertension hemodynamics in cirrhosis patients [19]
Samples of Formulae: tian wang bu xin dan (Tian Wang Bu Xin Dan, Heavenly Emperor Heart-Nourishing Pill)
Contraindications:
Administration of tinctures of this herb can lead to severe itching, stomachache, or reduced appetite.
While taking dan shen do not use soy milk or soy product because milk or soy product can lower the effectiveness of dan shen. Do not use with blood thinning drugs, like warfarin, heparin etc.
The active ingredient, tanshinone, can combine with soy product and form insoluble substance, thus lessen the effectiveness of blood thinning, pain arresting.
Research:
anti-HBV effect is stronger when combined with zhu ling (Polyporus sclerotium) [1]
Pharmacologic actions include antifibrosis of liver; enhances preservation of donor liver; removes oxygen free radicals in liver cells; reduces damage from ischemia and reperfusion, reduces fatty degeneration and necrosis of liver cells; promotes regeneration of remnant liver; prevents recurrence and metastasis of liver cancer; affects portal hypertension hemodynamics in cirrhosis [19]
Modulates cancer growth and metastases [20]
Chemical Ingredients: tanshiquinone A, B, C (丹参醌A, B, C)
danshen spiroketal lactone (丹参隐螺内酯)
danshensuan A, B, C (丹参酸甲、乙、丙)
ursolic acid (熊果酸/烏索酸/烏蘇酸)
daucosterol (胡蘿蔔苷/胡蘿蔔甙/胡蘿蔔甾醇)
References: [1] Chinese journal of integrated traditional and Western medicine 1993 Sep;13(9):533-5, 516-7.
[19] 裴蕾 任英 裴蕾(黑龍江農墾總局醫院,黑龍江,哈爾濱,150036) 任英(哈爾濱鬆江電機廠醫院,黑龍江,哈爾濱,150040) 刊 名：中醫藥學報 2002 年， 30(1) 英文刊名：ACTA CHINESE MEDICINE AND PHARMACOLOGY , 2002 30(1)
Original Text:
dan shen, Complementary and Alternative Healing UniversityComplementary and Alternative Healing University

　 dan shen      丹參  （in English and Chinese 中英文)by: Joe Hing Kwok ChuPharmaceutical name:英文藥名：Radix Salvia miltiorrhizaeBiological name:拉丁學名：Salvia miltiorrhiza Bge.Pron. in Japanese:日語發音：tanjinPron. in Korean:韓語發音：daan1 samPron. in Cantonese:粤語發音：tan sam1Other Names:別名：chi shen 赤參，zi dan shen 紫丹參，chao dan shen ，bie xue dan shen 鱉血丹參。Common Name:英文名：salvia rootDistribution:分佈：Hebei, Shanxi, Inner Mongolia, Liaoning, Jilin河北，山西，內蒙古，遼寧，吉林。Properties (characteristics)：性味：bitter, slightly cold味苦微寒。Channels (meridians) entered:歸經﹕heart and liver入心﹐ 肝二經。Actions & Indications: 主 治 ﹕rid of clot blood, pain, invigorate blood, breakup blood stasis,  for dysmenorrhea, amenorrhea, palpable tumors, angina, heat bi, restlessness and insomnia, irritability, swollen spleen, pain in digestive system,功能活瘀血, 止痛﹐ 經痛﹐ 無月經﹐可生新血,涼血,可觸知的腫瘤﹐心�けh﹐熱庳﹐煩燥不安﹐ 脾腫﹐ 消化系統疼痛。Medical Function:药理：antithromboticantihypertonic (lowering blood pressure)antimicrobial
  anti HBV effect. The anti HBV effect is stronger when combine with
  zhu ling [1]antipyretic anti-inflammatoryhepatoprotective: inhibits fibrinogen and aids in the resorption of fibrous plaques in the liver.sedativemodulate cancer growth and metastases [20]Significantly increase in coronary blood flow due to reduction of vascular resistance.藥理：抗血液凝结降血壓抗菌
 抗乙型肝炎病毒；如配合豬苓其抗乙型肝炎病毒的作用會增強[1]退焼抗炎保肝作用:抗肝纖維化;提高供體肝臟的保存效果;消除肝細胞氧自由基; 減輕肝臟冷熱缺血再灌注後的損害; 減輕肝細胞脂肪變性和壞死;促進殘肝再生;防治肝癌轉移復發;對肝硬化門靜脈高壓血流動力學有影響.[19]鎮静抑制癌腫之增長與擴散 [20]可增加冠 狀動脉流量，因為丹参能减低血管阻力。Chemical ingredients:[n]化學成份：[n]tanshinone丹參酮cryptotanshinone[隐丹参酮hydroxytanshinone羟基丹参酮methyl tanshinonate丹参酸甲酯.przewatanshinquinone A紫丹参甲素przewatanshinquinone B紫丹参乙素miltirone次甲丹参醌dihydrotanshinone二氢丹参酮nortanshinone去甲丹参酮1, 2, 15, 16-tetrahydrotanshiquinone1,2,15,16-四氢丹参醌isotanshinone異丹參酮isocryptotanshinone異隐丹参酮salviol鼠尾草酚,tanshialdehyde.丹参醛tanshinol A丹參素Atanshinol B丹參素Btanshinol C丹參素C3-α-hydroxy tanshinone3-α-羥基丹參酮tanshiquinone A, B, C丹参醌 A, B, Csaloilenone二萜荼苯酮danshen spiroketal lactone丹参隐螺内酯danshensuan A, B, C丹参酸甲、乙、丙protocatechuic acid原兒茶酸protocatechuic aldehyde原兒茶醛dihydroxybenzoic acid二羟苯甲酸protocatechuic aldehyde原兒茶醛baicalin黄芩甙 β-sitosterolβ-轂固醇ursolic acid熊果酸/烏索酸/烏蘇酸daucosterol胡蘿蔔苷/胡蘿蔔甙 /胡蘿蔔甾醇isoferulic acid異阿魏酸dihydroisotanshinone 二氫異丹參酮Dosage:用量：6 to 15 g6~15克Samples of formulae:處方舉例：tian wang bu xin dan 天王補心丹Modern Research:现代研究：　　Cautions:禁忌：Administration of tinctures of this herb can lead to severe itching, stomachache, or reduced appetite.While taking dan shen do not use soy milk or soy product because milk or soy product can lower the effectiveness of dan shen. Do not use with blood thinning drugs, like warfarin, heparin etc.The active ingredient, tanshinone, can combine with soy product and form insoluble substance, thus lessen the effectiveness of blood thinning, pain arresting.服用丹参酒浸剤可能導致激烈的發癢，肚痛，食慾减退。用丹参時，不要用奶或豆類制品以免降低療效。 不可與抗凝血药物 如華法林，肝素 同用。丹參酮和豆奶容易形成不溶物，降低了丹參的活血化淤、理氣止痛的作用。

Geography: China (throughout, especially Anhui, Henan, Sichuan, Hunan, Shaanxi, Shandong, Gansu, Guizhou)
Maladies Treated: purpura due to low platelet count
cholinergic hives (hives appear in response to a rise in body temperature from exercise, overheating, or stress)
Medical Function: clears heat and cools the blood
clear blood stasis and rid of clots
drain pus and reduces swelling due to blood stasis
anti inflammatory and effect on immune system
effect on secretion of water and sodium when dosage is increased. Low dosage does not have effect on secretion of potassium. At highest dosage secretion of potassium is decreased.
Samples of Formulae: dan zhi xiao yao san (丹梔逍遙散)
Contraindications: Not to use in cold disorder, pregnancy, excessive menstruation, bleeding, yin deficiency with night sweat. Not compatible with tu si zi (Cuscuta seed), bei mu (Fritillaria), da huang (Rhubarb), and da suan (garlic).

dan pi, 丹皮; 
        mu dan pi, 
        牡丹皮 


        (in English and Chinese 中英文)
        


        by: Joe Hing Kwok Chu
Click 
        her to see picture of herb and plant. 按此看圖。



Pharmaceutical name:
英文藥名：


Cortex Moutan Radicis




Biological name:
拉丁名：


Paeonia suffruticosa 
            Andr.




Pron. in Japanese：
日語發音:


botanpi




Pron. in Korean:
韓語發音：


moktanpi






            Pron. in Cantonese:

粵語發音：

maau5 daan1 pei4



Common Name:
英文名：


peony root




Distribution:
分布：


throughout China, especially  
            in Anhui, Henan, Sichuan, Hunan, Shaanxi, 
            Shandong, Gansu, Guizhou
遍布於全國， 
            尤其在安徽，河南，四川，湖南，陕西，山東，甘肃，貴州。




Properties (characteristics)
性味：


acrid, bitter, mildly cool
辛，苦，略涼。




Channels (meridians) 
            entered:
歸經：


heart, liver, kidney
心，肝，腎。




Actions & 
            Indications:
主治：


clears heat and cools the 
            blood, clears fire of yin deficiency, clear blood stasis and rid of 
            clots, drain pus and reduces swelling due to blood stasis.
清熱，涼血。去陰虛之火，排膿，消血瘀之腫。




Medical Function:
藥理：




1. effect on circulation


2. anti micro organism


3. anti inflammatory,  
              and effect on immune system


4. effect on CNS


5. effect on secretion 
              of water and sodium when dosage is increased. Low dosage does not 
              have effect on secretion of potassium. At highest dosage secretion 
              of potassium is  decreased.


　


對血液循環作用


抗微生物作用


抗炎，免疫作用


對中區腦神經作用


劑量增加時有排鈉與排水作用。低劑量對排鉀無作用。高劑量對排鉀作用降低。






Chemical ingredients:
化學成分：


paeonol, paeonoside, paeonolide, 
            apiopaeonoside
paeoniflorin, ozypaeoniflorin, 
            benzoylpaeoniflorin, benzoyl-oxypaeoniflorin
gallic aid, 1,23,4,6-pentagalloylglucose





Dosage:

用量：


6 to 12 g
6∼12克。





Samples of formulae:

處方舉例：



dan 
            zhi xiao yao san 丹梔逍遙散

　




Modern Application:
現代應用：


1. purpura due to low platelet 
            count
2. infectious diarrhea
3. hypertension
4. allergenic rhinitis
5. cholinergic hives 
            （hives appear in response to a rise in body temperature from 
            exercise, overheating, or stress）.
血小板低下所引起之紫斑
感染性之腹瀉
血壓高
鼻敏感
膽鹼功能性風疹 
            （體溫升高時，如運動，過熱，神經壓力所引起的）。




Cautions:
禁忌：


not to use in cold disorder, 
            pregnancy, excessive menstruation, bleeding,
            
yinxu (yin deficient)
with night sweat.
Not compatible with
            
tu 
            si zi ,
            
            bei mu,
            
            da huang, and
            
            da suan
有下列情形忌用：寒證，月經過多，出血， 
            
 陰虛盜汗。
反菟絲子，貝母，大黃 
             ，大 
            蒜。

Name: hai zao
Biological: Sargassum pallidum (Turn.) C. Ag. (大葉海藻)
Sargassum fusiforme (Harv.) Setch. (羊棲菜小葉海藻)

Geography: Cultivated in Fujian, Zhejiang, Guangdong, Liaoning, Shandong, Taiwan provinces
Contraindications:
Not to use in cases of pixu (spleen deficient).
Some traditional sources mentioned that hai zao is not compatible with gan cao (licorice root), but in clinical application it is being used with gan cao.
Original Text:
hai zao, sea weed, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

        hai zao 海藻

by: Joe Hing kwok Chu



Pharmaceutical name:
英文藥名﹕

Herb Sargassi



Botanical name:
學名﹕


Sargassum 
            siliquastrum Ag

Sargassum pallidum (Turn.) C. Ag.（大 
            葉海藻)

Sargassum fusiforme (Harv.) Setch. 
            (羊棲菜小葉海藻)




Pron. in Japanese:
日語發音﹕

kaiso



Pron. in Korean:
韓語發音﹕

haecho





            Pron. in Cantonese::
粵音﹕

hoi2 zou2



Other Names:
別名﹕

 



Common Name:
英文名﹕

sea weed



Distribution:
產地﹕

栽培於福建，浙江，廣東，遼寧，山東，臺灣等省。Being cultivated 
            in Fujian, Zhejiang, Guangdong, Liaoning, Shandong, Taiwan provinces.




Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕

苦，鹹，寒。bitter, salty, cold.




Channels (meridians) entered:
 
歸經﹕

腎，肝，肺，胃。kidney, liver, lung, stomach.



Medical functions:
藥理﹕
 

 



Actions & 
            Indications:
主治﹕

Being used in goiter, scrofula, cough, asthma, 
            haemorrhoids, runny nose, discomfort in digestive tract, pain in hernia, 
            pain and swelling of testes, as diuretics for edema, and as antipyretic.
            用於甲狀腺腫，瘰歷（頸部淋巴腺結核），利尿消腫，退燒、治咳，以及治療氣喘，咳 嗽， 痔瘡、流鼻涕、腸胃不適，疝氣痛，睪丸腫痛，泌 
            尿疾病等




Chemical ingredients:
化學成份﹕

 



Daly Dosage:
每日用量﹕

4.5 - 15 g



Samples of formulae
:處方舉例﹕

 



Modern Research:
現代研究﹕

 




Toxicity & Cautions:

毒素與禁忌﹕

Not to use in cases of 
pixu (spleen deficient).  
            Some traditional sources mentioned that hai zao is not compatible with
            
gan cao but 
            in clinical application it is being used with
            gan cao.

 脾 
            虛者忌用。傳統認為海 
            藻反甘 
            草，但臨床也每有配伍用者。。

Medical Function: calms the heart and spirit, clears heat and transforms phlegm
Samples of Formulae:
For mania and schizophrenia: sheng tie luo yin (sheng tie luo decoction).
Composition: tian men dong (Asparagus tuber, remove core), mai dong (Ophiopogon tuber, remove core), bei mu (Fritillaria bulb) 9g each, nan xing (Arisaema), ju hong (Citrus), yuan zhi (Polygala), shi chuang pu (Acorus tatarinowii), lian qiao (Forsythia), fu ling (Poria), fu shen (Poria spiritus) 3g each, xuan shen (Scrophularia root), gou teng (Uncaria), dan shen (Salvia miltiorrhiza) 4.5g each, zhu sha (cinnabar, HgS) 0.9g, tie luo (iron filings) 30g (packed separately).
Directions: Boil tie luo for 3 hours, use the resulting water to decoct other herbs and take as prescribed. After taking, rest quietly; avoid frightening or waking abruptly, as this may cause relapse and make recovery difficult.
Excerpted from: "Yixue Xinwu", Volume Four.
Contraindications: Not compatible with zao jiao (Gleditsia sinensis). According to Li Shi Zhen: "Most tonic herbs are not compatible with tie luo.
Notes:
Source of tie luo: when raw iron is heated red hot, the oxidized outer layer falls off when being pounded. The falling off particles is call tie luo.
 The particles that drop down from striking red hot iron are called tie luo. 
 The dust particle produced while striking the red hot iron is called tie jing. 
 rust on iron is called tie xiu 
 Those from soaking with salted vinegar is called tie hua.
Original Text: tie luo, Complementary and Alternative Healing UniversityComplementary and Alternative Healing University  Home  現代中藥辭典Search this siteList of Health ProblemsChinese Herb DictionaryQigongTraditional Chinese Medicine (TCM)AcupuncturePrescribed Drug DictionaryBiochemistry DictionaryLecture SlidesResearch LibrarianGeneral Online LibrarySearchResearch SitesViagraMassage/AcupressureHypnotherapyTell us what you wantNotify Changes & New Information　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　　tie luo 鐵落by: Joe Hing Kwok ChuSource of tie luo: when raw iron is heated red hot, the oxidized outer layer falls off when being pounded. The falling off particles is call tie luo.[來源]為生鐵鍛至紅赤、外層氧化時被錘落的鐵屑。 　Pharmaceutical name:英文藥名﹕Frusta ferriChemical name:化學名﹕magnetite氧化鐵﹐磁鐵礦Pron. in Japanese:日語發音﹕shotetsoraku （生铁落）Pron. in Korean:韓語發音﹕saengchollak  （生铁落）Pron. in Cantonese:粵音﹕tit3 lok6Other Names:別名﹕tie zhen hua鐵針花，tie hua鐵花，sheng tie luo生鐵落。the particles that drop down from striking red hot iron are called tie luo.生鐵煆紅放砧上，打落者名鐵落。the dust particle produced while striking the red hot iron is called tie jing敲打時如塵飛起者，名鐵精。rust on iron is called tie xiu鏽生鐵器上者，名鐵鏽。those from soaking with salted vinegar is called tie hua.鹽醋浸出者，名鐵華。　Common Name:英文名﹕magnetiteDistribution:產地﹕most parts of the worldProperties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕acrid, cool.辛，涼 。Channels (meridians) entered:　歸經﹕heart, liver.心， 肝。Medical functions:藥理﹕　　Actions & Indications:主治﹕For: stabilizing mood, as sedative, blood tonic.Being used in treating schizophrenia, mania, hallucination caused by high fever, palpitation and fright, rheumatoid arthritis, swelling in boils, and anemia.平肝鎮驚，解毒斂瘡，補血。主治癲狂，熱病譫妄，心悸易驚，風濕痺痛，瘡瘍腫毒，貧血。Chemical ingredients:化學成份﹕Main ingredient is Fe3O4, usually also contains other elements like: magnesium, manganese, titanium, vanadium, chromium etc.Fe3O4;常含有Mg，Mn，Ti，V，Cr等元素; 　Dosage:用量﹕　Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕For mania and schizophrenia: sheng tie luo yin狂躁不安﹕ 生鐵落飲Modern Research:現代研究﹕　Cautions:禁忌﹕not compatible with zao jiao. According to Li Shi Zhen: "Most tonic herbs are not compatible with tie luo."畏皂角。李時珍曰：補腎藥多忌之。　sheng tie luo yin (source: yixue xin yu) Composition: tian men dong (remove core), mai dong (remove core), bei mu 9 g, nan xing,  ju hong, yuan zhi,  shi chuang pu, lian qiao,  fu ling, fu shen, 3 g each,  xuan shen,  gou teng,  dan shen,  4.5g, each,  zhu sha (HgS)  0.9 g,  tie luo 30 g　　Sponsors' Ads by Google 以下為谷歌所提供贊助者之廣告 生鐵落飲 《醫學心語》　【功能主治】鎮 心安神，清熱化痰。治癲、狂、癇。　【處方】 天門冬（去心），麥 冬（去心），貝 母 各 9克 ，膽南 星 ，橘 紅 ，遠 志， 石菖蒲，連 翹， 茯 苓，茯 神，各3克 ，玄 參，鉤 藤  ， 丹 參 各 4.5克 ，辰砂  0.9克，  生鐵 落 30克 （另包）。  【用法用量】用生鐵落煎熬三小時，取此水煎藥服。服後安神靜睡，不可驚駭叫醒，犯之則病復 作，難乎 為力。 　  【摘錄】《醫學心悟》卷四Click here for inquiry  　More material to be loaded.
